title: Ticket #3813: shared port should be enabled by default
description:
NOTE: CHILD TICKETS MUST BE RESOLVED BEFORE THIS TICKET IS RESOVLED

To make it easier for HTCondor to work in private networks, we want the shared port feature to be enabled by default. We also want it to use a specific port number by default, rather than a dynamic port number.

Design doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UMz24DG1rOsMfKqiOzo_nSEXIGcRHAfdNuzEI-Wv5vQ/edit?usp=sharing
remarks:
2013-Jul-30 14:15:41 by tannenba:
Re how to handle the collector: Another idea would be for the shared port daemon to automagically forward any "undecorated" connection to the collector. This would get around the backwards-compatibility problem with folks needing to change CONDOR_HOST, and it would also enable all HTCondor nodes to use just the one well-known 9618 port by default (instead of requiring two ports on the cm, one for the shared port service and one for the collector).

Dan, what do you think re the above? What would it take? (2 hours, 2 days, 2 weeks?)

2013-Jul-30 16:46:39 by danb:
Very roughly, I think it would take about a week of effort to iron out all the details of transparently handling the collector.

UDP is one issue. One way to deal with it would be to have the shared port server not listen on the UDP port, so the collector can listen on it directly. This "half shared port" mode will require a little mucking around to get right, but I can't think of any major roadblocks. That just leaves TCP, which should be straightforward. I suppose we could even forward SOAP requests.

Are there any cases of commands where it would be ambiguous whether that command should go to the shared port server or to the collector? How about signals under windows? I suppose the master could send signals to the shared port server via TCP, and to the collector via UDP. Seems a little fiddly. How about DC_AUTHENTICATE? The only thing I can think of that needs to authenticate to shared_port is the master when it sends signals in windows. These days, children are born with a security session for this purpose, so I don't think this case presents a problem.

2013-Dec-30 18:34:37 by bbockelm:
Branch posted to https://github.com/bbockelm/htcondor/tree/default_shared_port (note that this is on top of the non-blocking shared port code in #4094).

I took tannenba's suggestion to have shared_port forward all unknown commands (which works out to be all commands except the shared_port command and DC_RAISESIGNAL) to a default shared port ID. You need to add the following to the config: 

SHARED_PORT_DEFAULT_ID=collector
COLLECTOR_ARGS = -sock collector
SHARED_PORT_ARGS = -p 9618
USE_SHARED_PORT = true
(I'd like to use TJ's new param table voodoo to get these to be set automatically as matt suggested in #2622, but couldn't figure it out...)

For UDP, I set the shared_port to not use UDP. If the collector is set to use the shared port, then the master gives the collector the UDP port but a randomly-selected TCP port.

Signals are not forwarded from the shared_port to the collector; as no new authentication session is ever needed, we never have to worry about the fact we do forward DC_AUTHENTICATE requests to the collector. The master sends signals to the collector via the collector's dedicated UDP socket. TCP updates are trivially handled; UDP updates first cause an authentication session to be created via TCP (forwarded from the shared_port) then the collector's UDP socket is used for the actual update.

I don't forward SOAP requests.

2013-Dec-30 19:16:38 by bbockelm:
Ok, the configuration gymnastics drove me a bit nuts... I added "COLLECTOR_USES_SHARED_PORT" (defaulting to true). If this is set and USE_SHARED_PORT=true, then the rest of the configuration is done automatically.

So basically we just need to default USE_SHARED_PORT to true and the whole stack should "just work".

2014-Mar-29 20:23:18 by bbockelm:
Hi Todd,

Now that 8.1.5 freeze has been made, should we work to merge this branch in for 8.1.6?

Brian

2014-Jul-11 10:54:41 by bbockelm:
Ok, I re-merged master into this branch and resolved all the conflicts. Should be in a reasonable state for review again.

2014-Jul-15 14:31:39 by bbockelm:
Code Review (from Todd and Jaime on phone)

  • EXCEPT if SOAP is enabled and shared port is.
  • Double-check if shared port is using 9618.
  • Keep this as default on all platforms.
  • WOULDBENICE: someone needs to simplify the crazy Create_Process argument list.
  • Who is responsible for cleaning up the shared port files? Note: after phone call, Brian confirmed condor_preen does this.
    • WOULDBENICE: Would be nice to use anonymous domain sockets instead.
  • Add version history
  • WOULDBENICE: Investigate upping the file descriptors to shared port. Note: this was done for v8.3.0 in commit [40637]
  • Update the design doc.
  • WOULDBENICE: Remove reply for shared port except on Mac OS.
  • Document new param knobs.

Once the concrete action items are (so, excluding WOULDBENICE items), this can be merged.

2014-Jul-23 08:43:25 by bbockelm:
Review items were fixed in follow-up commits.

The only big deviation is I did not set this as default on Windows; batlab test failures appeared to reveal a threading issue and I'm not really qualified to fix (I haven't owned a copy of Windows for quite some time...).

NOTE NOTE NOTE: One thing we overlooked in the original review is that this represents a pretty key behavior change. Worker nodes and submit nodes will now use port 9618 by default. This is going to upset glideins; accordingly, I introduced a new parameter, SHARED_PORT_PORT, which controls the default port used by shared port (otherwise, you have to muck with the SHARED_PORT_ARGS -- not very friendly).

The default of SHARED_PORT_PORT is 9618; admins can set it to 0 to restore the prior behavior. This configuration will be superseded by the collector port if the master launches a collector.
